title.value: Prediction and Control in Continual Reinforcement Learning
title.justification: The title clearly summarizes the main focus of the paper, which aligns with the presented content on continual reinforcement learning and the proposed techniques.
title.quote: Prediction and Control in Continual Reinforcement Learning

extractions.description: The paper focuses on value function estimation in continual reinforcement learning. It proposes decomposing the value function into two components updated at different timescales: a permanent value function (learning general knowledge) and a transient value function (for quick adaptation). Empirical studies show the approach improves performance on prediction and control tasks.

type.justification: The paper includes empirical case studies and experiments demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed method in different environments.
type.quote: Empirical case studies of the proposed approaches in simple gridworlds, Minigrid [11], JellyBeanWorld (JBW) [31], and MinAtar environments [51].

name.justification: The paper involves advancements in reinforcement learning, a subfield of deep learning.
name.quote: Deep reinforcement learning (RL) has achieved remarkable successes in complex tasks...

name.justification: The entire paper is focused on the value function estimation and the stability-plasticity dilemma in reinforcement learning.
name.quote: In this paper, we focus on value function estimation in continual reinforcement learning.

name.justification: The model is specifically proposed for improving value function estimation in continual reinforcement learning through the use of permanent and transient value functions.
This model extends PT-TD learning to tasks where the agent needs to learn the optimal policy through value function estimation.
Minigrid is used for value function estimation tasks under continual reinforcement learning settings.
name.quote: Empirical case studies of the proposed approaches in simple gridworlds, Minigrid [11], JellyBeanWorld (JBW) [31], and MinAtar environments [51].

name.justification: JBW is employed to test the effectiveness of the proposed method in a dynamic and complex environment.
name.quote: Empirical case studies of the proposed approaches in simple gridworlds, Minigrid [11], JellyBeanWorld (JBW) [31], and MinAtar environments [51].

name.justification: MinAtar provides a range of tasks for evaluating reinforcement learning algorithms under continual learning settings.
name.quote: Empirical case studies of the proposed approaches in simple gridworlds, Minigrid [11], JellyBeanWorld (JBW) [31], and MinAtar environments [51].

name.justification: The stochastic gradient descent (SGD) optimizer is used for updating the model parameters, especially for the permanent value function.
name.quote: We use SGD optimizer to update its weights.

name.justification: Adam optimizer is employed for training neural network models within the experiments.
name.quote: The network is trained using Adam optimizer with experience replay and a target network.
